Author: jansako#3330
Content:
@ComputerGenie 
1) the instant you make your anti-ASIC case about a single company and not about ASICs, you've already lost any validity your case might have. 

Suspect the 'you' in this case is not myself personally... cause I am not making an anti-asic case. I am not anti or for ASIC, I buy hardware I think will make me money. My point was that the main 'anti-Bitmain' sentiment is that they are doing shady stuff with hardware. I don't see NVidia or AMD doing that... it is downright silly to think NVidia is running a  bunch of GPU's mining somewhere... But according to the 'info' floating around, Bitmain is doing just that. That is why you cannot compare the two.

2) Why should there be a "why" statement about nothing changing?(edited)

The statement is needed because there are people asking for a change/pushing for change. There is a 'discussion' in a number of coins communities going on whether coins should or should not change because ASICS, and since KMD decided that it will not change, it would put some (notice I said some!) of the 'you all love Bitmain' bullshit to rest. 
More importantly, it would give the mods an ability to just point to an article and stop rehashing the same arguments. Starting with JL who is prbably spending way too muc time on this.

3) In your theory that the algo should change to prevent BM from silently mining on their own, what's to prevent them from adding RAM, mining on their own, and then never releasing just to spite the assholes who changed 2 variables in an attempt to financially hurt BM?
No idea what theory are you talking about... you may be responding to someone else here...

Author: jansako#3330
Content: sorry, just passing by... will respond in DM a bit later if appropiate

Author: ComputerGenie#2331

Author: bishop#9773
Content: I haven't tried it yet, but in theory, if I have agama running locally and setgenerate true, can't I point my miners at the local ip with the rpc user/pw in the config file to mine solo?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: no, komodod (the daemon behind Agama) lacks the API to mine GPUs and ASICs without a stratum program running as well

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: that and stratums are more efficient in handling more than 1 miner than a wallet anyway

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: also, `setgenerate true` = CPU mining

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: I had toyed with the idea of modding the in-wallet tromp to accept an API and essentially add an internal stratum, but for 100 different reasons decided there was no point

Author: bishop#9773
Content: So you're just pooling up all your hash vs soloing?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: traditional, direct-to-wallet mining (using getwork) pretty much ended for most everything years ago when slush came out with the stratum concept

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: if you find one that has getwork, chances are more than likely that the code was forked from Bitcoin pre-2015

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: modern "solo mining" = you in a "pool" by yourself

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Fair enough, I'll set one up on my node
